revised_title: Observations on the Coagulation Properties of Salmonidae Ova
tldr: John Davy investigates the coagulation properties of salmon eggs, examining the effects of water, heat, alkalies, salts, acids, and other agents on the vitellus. He concludes that the coagulation of salmon eggs may serve a purpose in attracting predators to the dead eggs, leaving the living ones more likely to survive.
